questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 42 cm and a width of 18 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(length + width) = 2(42 + 18) = 2(60) = 120 cm

questions.question: The area of a square is 441 square meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Area of square = side² = 441. Therefore, side = √441 = 21 meters. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 21 = 84 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 19 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Area of circle = πr² = (22/7) × 19 × 19 = 1134 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a regular hexagon is 96 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular hexagon, all sides are equal. Perimeter = 6 × side length. Therefore, side length = 96 ÷ 6 = 16 cm

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 20 cm, 99 cm, and 101 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (20-99-101). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 20 × 99 = 990 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 280 square meters and its length is 28 meters. What is its width?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 280 ÷ 28 = 10 meters

questions.question: A circle has a diameter of 34 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter = (22/7) × 34 = 106 cm

questions.question: The area of a parallelogram is 168 square centimeters and its height is 14 centimeters. What is its base?
questions.explanation: Base = area ÷ height = 168 ÷ 14 = 12 cm

questions.question: A square has the same perimeter as a rectangle with length 32 cm and width 24 cm. What is the area of the square?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(32 + 24) = 112 cm. Side of square = 112 ÷ 4 = 28 cm. Area of square = 28 × 28 = 784 cm²

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 240 square meters. Its parallel sides are 30 meters and 50 meters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 240) ÷ (30 + 50) = 480 ÷ 80 = 6 meters

questions.question: A regular pentagon has a perimeter of 85 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular pentagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 5 = 85 ÷ 5 = 17 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 176 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 176. Therefore, r = 176 ÷ (2 × 22/7) = 28 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 28 × 28 = 2464 cm²

questions.question: A rectangle has a perimeter of 72 cm and a width of 16 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width). Therefore, length = (72 ÷ 2) - 16 = 20 cm. Area = length × width = 20 × 16 = 320 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rhombus is 156 square centimeters and one of its diagonals is 26 centimeters. What is the length of the other diagonal?
questions.explanation: Area of rhombus = (1/2) × product of diagonals. Therefore, other diagonal = (2 × area) ÷ given diagonal = (2 × 156) ÷ 26 = 12 cm

questions.question: A circle has an area of 1017.36 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 1017.36. Therefore, r² = 1017.36 ÷ 3.14 = 324. Therefore, r = √324 = 18 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a rectangle is 64 cm and its area is 252 square centimeters. What are its dimensions?
questions.explanation: Let length = l and width = w. Then 2(l + w) = 64 and l × w = 252. Solving these equations gives l = 18 cm and w = 14 cm

questions.question: A regular octagon has a perimeter of 120 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular octagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 8 = 120 ÷ 8 = 15 cm

questions.question: The area of a triangle is 84 square centimeters and its base is 21 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ base = (2 × 84) ÷ 21 = 8 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same area. The rectangle has length 36 cm and width 16 cm. What is the perimeter of the square?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = 36 × 16 = 576 cm². Side of square = √576 = 24 cm. Perimeter of square = 4 × 24 = 96 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 138.16 cm. What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter. Therefore, diameter = circumference ÷ π = 138.16 ÷ 3.14 = 44 cm

questions.question: A parallelogram has a base of 28 cm and a height of 16 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of parallelogram = base × height = 28 × 16 = 448 cm²

questions.question: The area of a circle is 452.16 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 452.16. Therefore, r² = 452.16 ÷ 3.14 = 144. Therefore, r = √144 = 12 cm

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 32 cm and an area of 288 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 288 ÷ 32 = 9 cm. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(32 + 9) = 82 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 100 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 100 ÷ 4 = 25 cm. Area = side² = 25 × 25 = 625 cm²

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 21 cm, 220 cm, and 221 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (21-220-221). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 21 × 220 = 2310 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 320 square meters and its width is 20 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 320 ÷ 20 = 16 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(16 + 20) = 72 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 22 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × 3.14 × 22 = 138.2 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 300 square centimeters. Its parallel sides are 40 centimeters and 60 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 300) ÷ (40 + 60) = 600 ÷ 100 = 6 cm

questions.question: A square has an area of 676 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Side length = √676 = 26 cm. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 26 = 104 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 157 cm. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 157. Therefore, r = 157 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 25 cm
